intro: Henckelia adenocalyx, commonly known as the hairy calyx bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive hairy calyx and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes other bellflowers. Henckelia adenocalyx is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
